member.name: T:Narumikazuchi.Generators.ByteSerialization.ByteSerializer
member.summary: Provides methods to serialize runtime objects into and from [] arrays or streams.
member.remarks: To make a runtime object serializable you can either decorate it with the , in which case the serialization code will be generated automatically, or write a for the type.

member.name: T:Narumikazuchi.Generators.ByteSerialization.FixedSerializationSizeAttribute
member.summary: Tells the code generator that this strategy will always occupy the same amount of bytes after serialization.
member.remarks: Mark implementations with this attribute to optimize the generated serialization code. Has no effect on any other class or struct.

member.name: M:Narumikazuchi.Generators.ByteSerialization.FixedSerializationSizeAttribute.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Tells the code generator that this strategy will always occupy the same amount of bytes after serialization.
member.remarks: Mark implementations with this attribute to optimize the generated serialization code. Has no effect on any other class or struct.

member.name: T:Narumikazuchi.Generators.ByteSerialization.IByteSerializable`1
member.summary: Provides methods necessary for serialization of the type .
member.remarks: While you can implement this interface yourself and you can then use it with the methods, this interface is mainly used by the code generator. The code generator is really efficient in writing serialization code, so try to use the code generator if possible.

member.name: M:Narumikazuchi.Generators.ByteSerialization.IByteSerializable`1.Deserialize(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte},System.Int32@)
member.summary: Deserializes the into a runtime object of type .
member.param: The buffer to read the bytes from.
The amount of bytes read from the buffer.
member.returns: The runtime object represented by the buffer.
